body.p: The installer gets its configuration information from the os-client-config ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml file.

ol.li: Create a plaintext file called clouds.yaml in that directory.
Enter the configuration information for the service(s) being installed. A sample configuration file is provided here.

body.p: Information on each field is below the code block. For more detailed information, see the OpenStack client configuration documentation.
body.codeblock: clouds: <mycloudname>: codn_username: < Helion Download Network user name> codn_password: < Helion Download Network password> horizon_url: http://<horizon-ip-address>/ region_name: region1 cacert: /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt auth: auth_url: <identity url> project_name: < admin project name> username: < admin user name> password: < admin password> database: ephemeral_ca_cert: unset external_network: <guid of ext-net> provider_network: <guid of svc-net> ntp_server: <ip address of ntp server> keypair: default enable_ha: false flavor: m1.medium database_flavor: m1.medium messaging_flavor: m1.medium database_volume_size: 10 logstash_rabbitmq_host: <ip address of logging service> logstash_rabbitmq_password: <password for logging service> hotpools_enabled: false hotpools_max_instances: 3 hotpools_image_name: percona hotpools_flavor_names: "m1.medium,m1.small,m1.large" disable_rollback: false project_id: <project id of user to install service to>

section.title: Server Information
section.p: This information is for the Deployer server. This section is required for installation of the Application Lifecycle Service.

sl.sli: mycloudname: The name of your cloud.
codn_username: The username for the HDN (Helion Download Network) account. (The name of the download network used to be CODN.)
codn_password: The password for the HDN (Helion Download Network) account. (The name of the download network used to be CODN.)
horizon_url: The URL where the Horizon management console can be accessed.
region_name: Default value is region1
cacert: The location where the SSL certificates can be accessed.

section.title: User Authentication Information (AUTH)
section.p: This section provides user authentication for performing installation. This section is required for installation of the Application Lifecycle Service.

sl.sli: auth: The Keystone v2 address found in the service.osrc file.
auth_url: This URL can be found in Horizon at: Project Compute > Access & Security > API Access. Copy the Service Endpoint URL for the Identity Service.
project_name: The Name of the admin project in Horizon.
username: The Username of an account with installation privileges (administrator).
password: The Password for the same account with installation privileges (administrator).

section.title: Database Information
section.p: This information is for the Database Service. This section is required for installation of the Database Service.

sl.sli: ephemeral_ca_cert: Value must be unset
external_network: <guid of ext-net>
provider_network: <guid of svc-net>
ntp_server: <ip address of ntp server>
keypair: default
enable_ha: Options are True or False. If True, the database will be created with high-availability configurations. Ensure you have enough quota to do so.
flavor: The default is m1.medium Do not create any flavor smaller than medium. Smaller sizes will cause installation to fail.
database_flavor: The default is m1.medium. Do not create any flavor smaller than medium. Smaller sizes will cause installation to fail.
messaging_flavor: The default is m1.medium. Do not create any flavor smaller than medium. Smaller sizes will cause installation to fail.
database_volume_size: 10
logstash_rabbitmq_host: <ip address of logging service>
logstash_rabbitmq_password: <password for logging service>
hotpools_enabled: Options are True or False. If True, hotpool capabilities are enabled. If False, you can remove all other hotpools configuration variables.
hotpools_max_instances: 3
hotpools_image_name: percona
hotpools_flavor_names: "m1.medium,m1.small,m1.large"
disable_rollback: Options are True or False. If True, rollback of patch applications is disabled.
project_id: <project id of user to install service to>
